p: Recently, a novel driver mutation in another deubiquitinating enzyme i.e., USP48, was found in patients negative for USP8 changes. USP48 pathogenic variants cause increased activity of encoded deubiquitinase against its substrates Gli1 and H2A [ 17]. Because USP48 mutations affect the processes of protein degradation similarly to mutations of USP8, we screened the tumor samples for both the mutations. Two samples with USP48 Met/Val variant were identified and excluded from differential miRNA analysis to avoid a bias resulting from similarities in pathogenic mechanism. Due to a very low number of USP48-mutated tumors, these patients were also excluded from the analysis of clinical data.
